In between Allen Iverson outbursts, Tyronn Lue stymied the NBA Most Valuable Player for nearly 20 minutes, using his quickness to prevent Allen Iverson from even getting the ball, let alone shoot it. He had spent the last two

in Turkey, returned to the U.S. to have a lesion surgically removed from his right leg, spurring rumors he will retire. Allen Iverson denies this, as he wrote on his Twitter account: I have never said anything about retirement, nor have I said goodbye to the game of basketball. Once I get past this, my plan is to continue playing at the highest level possible. So don't put me in my rocking chair just yet. Hold on, I'll be back! It's not yet known if the lesion is benign or not, or if it's a cyst. Allen Iverson , 35, is expected to be out for several weeks

They largely echoed his memoir, in which he laid blame for much of the failings and heavy bloodshed of the Iraq war on too many hands on the steering wheel. Donald Rumsfeld , who served as Bush's defense chief for six years after holding the the same job under president Gerald Ford in the 1970s, acknowledged that "in a war, many things cost lives."
